feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operational reality summary for "daily wage calculator" based on Jira evidence: - Findings / issues / limitations: 3 - Troubleshooting / edge cases / requests: 2 - Evidence suggests asynchronous updates or synchronization considerations. - Evidence includes UI/visibility or copy/label concerns.

findings.group_description: Daily wage calculations involve complex configurations with multiple potential divisors and calculation methods.
findings.issue_explanation: The system supports multiple approaches to calculating daily wage, including basic salary divided by 30, 30.42, or working days, with variations in how public holidays and weekends are handled.
findings.limitation_statement: The platform lacks a unified, transparent method for daily wage calculations across different scenarios.
findings.gap_statement: Users need clearer documentation explaining how different divisors and configuration settings impact daily wage computations.

findings.group_description: Inconsistent handling of leap year days in service duration and gratuity calculations.
findings.issue_explanation: The system sometimes fails to correctly account for 366 days in leap years, potentially impacting end-of-service calculations.
findings.limitation_statement: Leap year logic is not consistently applied across different calculation scenarios.
findings.gap_statement: Enhanced leap year detection and handling mechanisms are needed to ensure accurate calculations.

findings.group_description: Global configurations can override policy-level settings in daily wage and leave calculations.
findings.issue_explanation: System-wide settings can supersede individual policy configurations, creating unexpected calculation behaviors.
findings.limitation_statement: Users have limited control over calculation methods when global settings are present.
findings.gap_statement: More transparent configuration hierarchy and user controls are needed.

troubleshooting.group_description: Manual adjustments required when automated proration fails
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: For inconsistent salary prorations, users may need to manually add or subtract small amounts to balance payroll calculations.

troubleshooting.group_description: Handling persistent deductions after leave request modifications
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Delete and recreate leave requests if deductions do not update correctly. Verify daily wage configurations before processing.

glossary.definition: Calculated rate of daily compensation, typically computed by dividing monthly salary by a specified number of days (30, 30.42, or working days).
Days considered for salary calculation, which may exclude weekends and public holidays based on specific work week configurations.
